conclusion: Liquid will flow out from openings A, B, C, and D and will end up in containers E or F after passing through baffles.
Opening A is located at the top left of the image, above a green baffle slanted to the right.
Openings B and C are located at the top center of the image, above a blue baffle slanted to the right.
Opening D is located at the top right of the image, with no baffle directly below it.
Container E is located at the bottom left of the image, connected to a white channel.
Container F is located at the bottom right of the image, connected to a blue channel.

premise: Stream A hits the green baffle and is deflected to the right.
conclusion: Liquid from opening A flows into the left-hand collection channel, which leads to container E.

premise: Streams B and C strike the blue slanted baffle and are deflected to the right together.
conclusion: Liquids from openings B and C flow into the right-hand collection channel, which leads to container F.

premise: Stream D drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Liquid from opening D flows directly into the right-hand collection channel, which leads to container F.

premise: Most liquid from A, B, C, and D flows into container F, with some droplets from A reaching container E.
conclusion: Most liquid from A, B, C, and D ends in container F, with some droplets from A reaching container E.
